metadata.titel_preek: The Trinity in the Last Ditch

kernfrasen: parent of a child... on the verge of destroying himself
like a parent agonizing because a child has fallen in with a fast crowd
bring the Corinthian church back into the fold
pours all their resources into you
pursues us even beyond the grave
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: FAITH IS STAYING ON THE TRACKS

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: The Trinity in the Last Ditch

doeldomein.theologisch_concept: The Trinity / Divine Presence in Crisis

mapping_structuur.doel_element: God's refusal to abandon the sinner

cognitieve_implicaties: God is found at the point of maximum failure, not just in 'glory'.
theologische_implicaties: The Trinity is not an abstract doctrine but a relational rescue operation.
ethische_implicaties: Believers should 'hang tough' with others even when rejected.
onbedoelde_consequenties: God might be seen as only reactive to crisis rather than proactive.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: Re-activates a dead idiom ('last ditch') by placing the Holy Trinity inside it, creating a shocking juxtaposition.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher uses the 'Desperate Parent' schema to bridge the gap between Paul's emotional distress and the abstract Trinitarian benediction.

incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: Ransom implies a third party to whom payment is due, while the relational metaphor focuses on the internal state of the lover.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The preacher uses the 'Flow' of the Spirit to connect the distinct persons of the Trinity into a single relational action.

sterktes.beschrijving: Takes the 'dead' Trinitarian formula and re-embodies it through the visceral experience of parental anxiety.
sterktes.voorbeeld: The church that was breaking his heart is the one that gets the full Trinitarian blessing.

risicos.beschrijving: Projecting human parental desperation (which includes helplessness) onto an omnipotent God.
risicos.voorbeeld: You are desperate. You would make a complete fool of yourself.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation may view God as lacking sovereignty or being emotionally volatile.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: A modern household with a self-destructing teenager (drugs, anorexia).
sub_worlds: The 'crabbed' and 'tumultuous' writing desk of the Apostle Paul.
The internal life of the Trinity as a 'dynamic interrelatedness'.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: By defining the Trinity through 'fellowship' and 'interrelatedness' rather than substance or essence.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Juxtaposing the benediction with Paul's 'agonized' and 'disjointed' letter.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Perfectly aligns with Trinity Sunday but disrupts the 'glory' schema with a 'suffering' schema.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the RELATIONAL domain, specifically the 'Agonizing Parent' source domain. This is supported by secondary ECONOMIC metaphors of 'extravagant cost' and PHYSICAL metaphors of 'holding fast' and 'last ditches.' The landscape is emotionally high-stakes, moving the Trinity from the classroom to the emergency room.

revitalisatie_suggesties.doel_metafoor: The Fellowship of the Holy Spirit
revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Connect 'fellowship' more deeply to the 'fast crowd' source domain used earlier.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: The Spirit is the 'crowd' that pulls you back when you've fallen in with the wrong influences.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: Paul as 'Barking Orders' vs. Paul as 'Agonizing Parent'
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Explain the 'orders' as the desperate cries of a parent seeing a child run into traffic.

entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Clarify that this is the 'foolishness of the Cross' (1 Cor 1), a deliberate subversion of worldly power.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To balance the 'fluid/emotional' metaphors with the 'stability' of the Trinity as a foundation.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in cognitive homiletics. By mapping the Trinity onto the most intense human experience (parental desperation), the preacher makes an abstract dogma feel like a life-raft.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: An aesthetic analysis would praise the 'agonized' prose; CMT reveals that this prose is a source domain for understanding divine empathy.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's focus on the 'experience' of the listener, CMT shows how the listener's existing 'Parent' schema is hijacked to explain the Godhead.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT identifies that the 'Last Ditch' is not just a title but a spatial container metaphor that defines the boundaries of God's reach.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully uses 'Schema Disruption' by taking the most 'formulaic' part of the liturgy (the benediction) and revealing it as a product of extreme emotional labor.
